result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L Hagge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth L Hagge

9:54 AM Defendant Kenneth L Hagge in court.  Attorney Alexia S Gianitsos in court for Kenneth L Hagge.  Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland.

Ct.1 - DRI.

30 days RCJ, cfts;

cc+DNA, pp $50/mo beg 11-1-22

**Deft has credit from 8/6/22 - 10/3/22 = 59 days**
Bond came back from RCJ missing 2nd page with Clerk's Signature.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance. Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
